item.title: In 7 Seasons, 'Fortnite' Hasn't Had One Female Tier-100 Skin - Forbes
item.description:
In 7 Seasons, 'Fortnite' Hasn't Had One Female Tier-100 Skin  Forbes

Fortnite We got our first look Fortnite: Battle Royale’s Season 7 battle pass yesterday. The start of a new season is Christmas morning for the ultra-popular battle royale title, with massive map changes, new items, new challenges and a whole new battle pass stacked with skins and other cosmetics ready for players to unlock once they’ve paid out $10. The batttle pass is the primary organizing principle of the game, and that’s why the leadup is so exciting every time: every season Fortnite players race to unlock the ultimate achievement: a Tier-100 battle pass and the elite skin that comes w...

item.title: Fortnite's New Season 7 Gun And Vehicle Wrap Skins May Be Epic's Huge New Moneymaker - Forbes
item.description:
Fortnite's New Season 7 Gun And Vehicle Wrap Skins May Be Epic's Huge New Moneymaker  Forbes

Fortnite While Fortnite earning $300 million a month has allowed Epic to do pretty much whatever they want, including opening up a competitor to Steam, obviously any successful company is going to keep looking for new ways to make money. And it may have just found a significant new path with the launch of season 7. For the first time, Fortnite season 7 has introduced “wraps,” which look like Christmas wrapping paper (an appropriate time to launch), but in practice serve as gun and vehicle skins for the first time. Right now you can apply the pattern to certain guns (shotguns and rifles I be...

item.title: Video game stocks get crushed as Fortnite reigns - CNN
item.description:
Video game stocks get crushed as Fortnite reigns  CNN

Fortnite and other so-called multiplayer battle royale games are all the rage. And investors in leading video game companies have been stuck doing the "take the L" Fortnite loser dance as a result. Shares of Activision Blizzard (ATVI) have plunged nearly 45% in the past two months. Electronic Arts (EA) is down almost 30%. And Take-Two Interactive (TTWO) has plummeted 25%, despite having a successful new game -- Red Dead Redemption 2. Fortnite may be stealing away some gamers thanks to the fact that it can be downloaded for free on iPhones and iPads, Android phones and tablets as well as pop...

item.title: Fortnite Videogame Star Ninja Drops An Album, And A Peek Into The Future - Forbes
item.description:
Fortnite Videogame Star Ninja Drops An Album, And A Peek Into The Future  Forbes

Justin Caruso (l.) and Ninja (Tyler Blevins) in Capitol Records Studio A Seventy feet from Nat King Cole’s piano, with Frank Sinatra’s microphones nearby, in Capitol Records’ historic Hollywood recording studios, a lanky guy with spiky aqua hair plays the world’s most popular video game alongside a string of musicians. It’s a decided change from the usual reasons people load thousands of dollars worth of expensive gear into Studio A, where countless musical stars have recorded hit records for decades. This Sunday night, it’s about Capitol, a division of Universal Music Group, trying to rema...

item.title: Here Are All The Leaked Skins And Cosmetics Found In Fortnite's Season 7 Patch - Forbes
item.description:
Here Are All The Leaked Skins And Cosmetics Found In Fortnite's Season 7 Patch  Forbes

Here are all the new skins and cosmetics found in the Season 7 patch. Today is a big day for Fortnite players. Season 7 kicked off earlier this morning, and with it we now have a bunch of leaked skins, gliders, back bling and other cosmetics slowly trickling out. You can see all the skins included in the Season 7 Battle Pass here. In the meantime, let’s take a look at the various skins/outfits and cosmetics that dataminers have uncovered since this morning’s v7.0 patch went live. Outfits Naturally the first leaked skins are pilot-themed. That makes sense given the inclusion of a new Named A...

item.title: Here Are All The New Season 7 Battle Pass Skins In 'Fortnite: Battle Royale' - Forbes
item.description:
Here Are All The New Season 7 Battle Pass Skins In 'Fortnite: Battle Royale'  Forbes

Check out the new skins in Fortnite’s Season 7 Battle Pass. Fortnite: Battle Royale Season 7 is almost upon us, and with it major changes to the game’s huge map including a brand new ice biome. We already have the crazy new patch notes which you can read here, and you can watch the festive new cinematic trailer here. And check out the rest of the Battle Pass for Season 7 here. And now that the servers are back up, we have the full cadre of Season 7 Battle Pass skins—four of which are “progressive” meaning they have special unlocks that add customization options as you progress. So let’s tak...

item.title: 'Fortnite' Season 7, Week 1 Challenges Revealed And How To Solve Them - Forbes
item.description:
'Fortnite' Season 7, Week 1 Challenges Revealed And How To Solve Them  Forbes

Here are Fortnite’s Season 7, Week 1 challenges and how to solve them. Season 7 of Fortnite: Battle Royale has arrived and with it a whole bunch of new challenges. These include the new Snowfall weekly challenge as well as challenges for several new characters in the Season 7 Battle Pass. We also have our first batch of Free and Battle Pass challenges as Season 7, Week 1 kicks off. Here they are: Free Challenges - Pick up an item of each rarity (0/5) 5 Battle Stars - Dance in different forbidden locations (0/7) 5 Battle Stars - Play matches with at least one elimination (HARD) (0/5) 10 Batt...

item.title: Where To Find Fortnite's Week 1 Hidden 'Snowfall Challenge' Battle Star - Forbes
item.description:
Where To Find Fortnite's Week 1 Hidden 'Snowfall Challenge' Battle Star  Forbes

Here’s where to find Fortnite’s first Snowfall challenge Battle Star. Fortnite’s seventh season has begun in earnest. Along with a ton of map changes, we have a new weekly challenge set. Replacing the Hunting Party challenges from Season 6 we have a new Snowfall challenge series. This time some pretty major things have changed, however. Like past seasons, completing every challenge in a week will get you a secret loading screen (week 1 pictured above, which you’ll get when you’ve completed week 1′s challenges) and that loading screen will lead to a hidden Battle Star or, presumably, a secre...

item.title: Watch The Festive 'Fortnite' Season 7 Cinematic Trailer Right Here - Forbes
item.description:
Watch The Festive 'Fortnite' Season 7 Cinematic Trailer Right Here  Forbes

Watch Fortnite’s Season 7 cinematic trailer right here. Fortnite: Battle Royale’s seventh Battle Pass season is upon us, just in time for the holidays. The mysterious iceberg has crashed into the island, and with it comes new snowy areas, planes and much more. (Read the patch notes here.) There’s also a brand new cinematic trailer and it’s very funny. The trailer opens to Crackshot, the Fortnite Nutcracker skin, decorating for Christmas. Check it out: I love the little claymation-looking dog and the cuckoo clock and pretty much the entire opening segment. You can see many of the game’s cla...

item.title: Creative Mode: What Is Fortnite's Big New Mode, And How Do You Play It? - Forbes
item.description:
Creative Mode: What Is Fortnite's Big New Mode, And How Do You Play It?  Forbes

Fortnite You might be zipping around in the new ice biome, testing out a plane or just beginning to level up your battle pass, but none of those things are the biggest changes that developer Epic Games dumped on Fortnite today. Fortnite: Battle Royale got a huge update, as it always does at the start of the season, but the biggest update to the wider Fortnite property is Creative Mode, a third mode for the game to stand alongside Save the World and Battle Royale. That top-level billing should give you a sense of how important this is to the game and its developer. So what is it? Epic detail...

item.title: Fortnite Season 7 start time and downtime confirmed as release hints at new planes - everything we know so far - The Telegraph
item.description:
Fortnite Season 7 start time and downtime confirmed as release hints at new planes - everything we know so far  The Telegraph

With Season 6 of Fortnite coming to its conclusion, Epic Games has confirmed the arrival of Fortnite Season 7 today. The developer has confirmed that Fortnite will go down at 9am UK time (4am ET) on 6 December as the new season is implemented. The downtime will likely last a few hour as the new Battle Pass, skins and features are added to the hit game. Patch notes detailing the changes and a new trailer will likely be released as the game updates. Epic first starting teasing the new season at the start of this week, with a tweet from the official Fortnite Twitter account that featured an im...

item.title: 'Fortnite' Season 7 Patch Notes: Airplanes, Vaulted Weapons And A Brand-New Ice Biome - Forbes
item.description:
'Fortnite' Season 7 Patch Notes: Airplanes, Vaulted Weapons And A Brand-New Ice Biome  Forbes

Fortnite It’s time for Season 7 in Fortnite: Battle Royale. We may have gotten an early look at the Season 7 Battle Pass courtesy of Fortnite Korea, but now we’re moving full-steam ahead with the actual release. At the time of this writing servers are down as we wait to get our hands on new weapons and new lands, but in the meantime, we’ve got the patch notes to keep ourselves occupied. There are a ton of changes as you might expect: not just the big new flashy additions, but continuing balance tweaks and big changes to the weapon loadout as well. Here’s what’s in Fortnite’s big v7.00 updat...

item.title: Here's All The Crazy, Frozen New Stuff On The 'Fortnite' Season 7 Map - Forbes
item.description:
Here's All The Crazy, Frozen New Stuff On The 'Fortnite' Season 7 Map  Forbes

Fortnite Fortnite players have woken up this morning to see the entire landscape of the map transformed. Well, at least a significant chunk of it. The polar opposite (no pun intended) of the desert biome before it, a giant iceberg/castle has appeared in the middle a new ice zone and has spread its chilly winds to probably 25-30% of the map. This has transformed many old areas and created some brand new ones as well. Here are the highlights of the new map additions: Polar Peak/Ice Castle The game identifies the giant iceberg as a mountain, but it’s very obvious that it’s a castle, frozen in ...

item.title: The Game Awards 2018 winners: God of War wins game of the year as Red Dead Redemption 2 rides home with four - The Telegraph
item.description:
The Game Awards 2018 winners: God of War wins game of the year as Red Dead Redemption 2 rides home with four  The Telegraph

Sony Santa Monica's God of War has won the Game of the Year award at The Game Awards 2018 ceremony. The acclaimed Norse adventure also picked up awards for best direction and best action-adventure. Rockstar's smash hit Western Red Dead Redemption 2 won the most awards, riding home with four. The sprawling adventure won best narrative, best performance for Roger Clarke as Arthur Morgan, best music for Woody Jackson and Daniel Lanois' score and best audio. Indie gem Celeste won two for best independent game and the Game for Impact award. And battle royale phenomenon Fortnite also took two wit...

item.title: 'Fortnite' Challenge: Where To Dance On Top Of A Metal Turtle (Stage 2) - Forbes
item.description:
'Fortnite' Challenge: Where To Dance On Top Of A Metal Turtle (Stage 2)  Forbes

Fortnite If you’ve arrived here, that means you have completed at least one task Fortnite season 7 has laid out for you, dancing on top of a crown of RVs. The next step in the multi-tier challenge is to dance on top of a metal turtle, something that again, I didn’t know the location of right away. I may be taking crazy pills, but I genuinely do not remember a giant metal turtle in the game, and I think these objects might be new. But tell me if I’m wrong. Anyway, if you’re like me and don’t know where this is, I’ve found him. The giant metal turtle is to the far east of the map, just above ...

item.title: Brooklyn rapper sues makers of Fortnite over claims video game stole his moves - The Guardian
item.description:
Brooklyn rapper sues makers of Fortnite over claims video game stole his moves  The Guardian

The rapper 2 Milly filed a lawsuit Wednesday against the makers of Fortnite, saying they were illegally using a dance he created in their wildly popular video game. The Brooklyn-based rapper, whose real name is Terrence Ferguson, alleges that the North Carolina-based Epic Games misappropriated his moves without compensation or credit in the lawsuit, filed in federal court in Los Angeles. The lawsuit states that the dance known on Fortnite as “Swipe It”, one of many that players can buy for their characters, is taken from the “Milly Rock”, a dance he came up with in 2011 that caught on as a ...
